intro: Impatiens declercqii, commonly known as the Congo impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
